text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Boeing Corp of United States baffled by crash of a Boeing 727 plane in Nigeria last Thursday killing all 142 people on board, says company spokesman who also tells Guardian Nigerian authorities have not yet asked Boeing to send investigator.
- Abuja airport in Nigerian capital renamed Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport after first Nigerian president whose funeral is now underway six month after he died at age of 91.
- Nigerian stock exchange screens Africoinvest Holdings Ltd of Cyprus which is bidding for 53 percent or 36.04 million shares of Carnaud Metal Box Toyo Glass Nigeria Ltd.
- Independent oil products marketers beg state-owned Nigerian National Petroleum Corp to pay off two billion naira debt owed them since 1993.
- Diplomatic initiative by Nigeria is underway at United Nations to stop resolution against the country on human rights being adopted by the organisation's general assembly.
- Nigerian pilots demand public inquiry into crash of Boeing 727 last Thursday as British re-insurers of plane arrive to determine claims to be paid to airline and victims' relatives.
- Two private fertiliser plants are planned for the country to boost agricultural output, says the firms involved.
